definition: to be concerned about/to care about
mountain pass/to close/to shut/to turn off/to concern/to involve
surname Guan
heart/mind/intention/center/core/CL:顆|颗[ke1],個|个[ge4]
not the least bit concerned/completely indifferent

sentences.english: 'They only pay attention to physics, mathematics and chemistry, ' says Mr. Pei.
sentences.chinese: 裴东光说，他们只关心数理化。

sentences.english: If she scolds you, it is because she cares for you.
sentences.chinese: 如果她骂你，是表示她“关心”你。

sentences.english: They are concerned with the training curriculum, but not the details of each course.
sentences.chinese: 他们参与培训课程，但是并不关心每一门课程的细节。

sentences.english: Seeing their children get married will always be their top concern.
sentences.chinese: 儿女的婚姻大事，永远都是他们最关心的事情。

sentences.english: It’s more the survival of the university that amazes and concerns me.
sentences.chinese: 我更关心的是大学是否能继续存在下去。

sentences.english: Starting from the map, the business processes of interest are then further detailed.
sentences.chinese: 从此图开始，将对所关心的业务流程进一步细化。

sentences.english: You lean, haggard, please allow me a million times care and long winded.
sentences.chinese: 你瘦了，憔悴了，请允许我千万次的关心和啰嗦。

sentences.english: Feng cares less about himself than the young people of his hometown.
sentences.chinese: 比起同乡的年轻人，峰更少关心他自己。

sentences.english: Zhou Gucheng concerns himself with Chinas modernization from the period of the War of Resistence Against Japan.
sentences.chinese: 从抗战时期起周谷城就关心国家的现代化问题。

sentences.english: We must concern ourselves with state affairs.
sentences.chinese: 我们必须关心国家大事。

sentences.english: Won't you do very good thoroughgoing care about I am?
sentences.chinese: 您是否不会做非常好彻底关心我是？

sentences.english: He really cares about his family.
What may count for more is that Mr Castro is increasingly preoccupied by his legacy.
sentences.chinese: 更重要的是卡斯特罗越来越关心他的身后事。

sentences.english: It also shows the Iranian authorities that people care and won't let them be forgotten," said Laura Fattal, mother of Josh Fattal.
sentences.chinese: 同时表明人民关心的伊朗当局不会让他们被遗忘”。

to care about/to mind
to show concern and care for
to care about/equivalent of 在於|在于[zai4 yu2]
to be deeply concerned/to be troubled (by)
to enquire solicitously about sb's well-being (idiom)/to pamper
to cherish/to treasure/to take care of/to love and protect
to take care of/to show consideration/to attend to/to look after
carefully/meticulously/to set one's heart on sth
to take care/to keep an eye on/to look after/to tell/to remind
to regard as important/to care about
to comprehend/to understand/comprehension/understanding
to empathize/to allow (for sth)/to show understanding/to appreciate
considerate (of other people's needs)
to esteem/to respect/to honor/to value/eminent/serious/proper
not the least bit concerned/completely indifferent
